greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of A000328(n)/n^2, where A000328(n) is the number of lattice points (x,y) with x^2 + y^2 <= n^2.
comment: First differs from A000328 at n=12: A000328(12) = 441, a(12) = 49.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Gauss's Circle Problem
maple: N:= 100: # to get a(1) to a(N)
for i from 0 to N do
for j from i while i^2 + j^2 <= N^2 do
elif i=0 or i=j then m:= 4
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Apr 17 2004
